title: Orange (colour)
summary: Orange is the colour between yellow and red on the spectrum of visible light. Human eyes perceive orange when observing light with a dominant wavelength between roughly 585 and 620 nanometres. In painting and traditional colour theory, it is a secondary colour of pigments, produced by mixing yellow and red. In the RGB color model, it is a tertiary colour. It is named after the fruit of the same name.
